Working with the File List

When you click the File tab, a list of files displays in the upper pane of the project view window. The File menu also becomes available on the menu bar.

All files shown in the upper pane:

  • Are attached to the folder selected from the application folder hierarchy.

  • Match the filter selected from the Filter drop-down list box.

  • Match the depth specified by the All Descendants button.

Using the File List

From the File list, you can perform a variety of operations, including:

Open or run files

Double-click a file name in the upper pane to run executable files or to open files in the application with which they are associated. However, to open a file in Notepad or an alternate editor, select File > Edit.

Move files

To move a file from one application folder or view or project to another, drag the file to its new folder. To share a file, press Ctrl, then drag the file to its new location. The original and the new folder must both use the same server configuration.

Share files

To share a file in one application folder with another folder, press Ctrl, then drag the change request to the second folder. You can also share files with other views or projects, as long as they use the same server configuration.

Filter data

You can rearrange fields, show different fields, use group bands, and apply queries to the data in the Change Request list. You can also save the operations performed on the data as a query or filter. To perform these actions from the context menu, right-click a column header to display the menu.

Sort data

Click a column header to sort the displayed files based on the value in that column. The sort is in ascending numeric, alphanumeric, or internal key order, depending on the data. To change the sort order from ascending to descending (or vice versa), click the header a second time. To show the order in which data has been sorted, the application displays a triangle in the column header. It points up if the sort is in ascending order, down if it is in descending order.

Default columns in the File list are:

  • Name: Name of the file.

  • Status: Status of the file. See Understanding File Status Information for a complete list.

  • Locked By: Name of the person, if any, who has locked the file.

  • Vault Branch Version: Revision of the file under version control (stored in Vault folder).

  • Content Revision: Tip revision of the file.

  • File Time Stamp at Check-in: Date and time file was last checked in.

  • Size: Size of the file in KB.

Refresh data

Press Shift + F5 to refresh the entire view, which includes all items on all tabs, as well as the application folder hierarchy. Press F5 to refresh only the File list. Press F6 to refresh external archives, such as VSS and PVCS.
